intro: Reseda stipulacea, commonly known as the narrow-leafed reseda, is a herbaceous annual plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Reseda stipulacea is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
